availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Rogers (Pendleton county KY famer & private 40th KY mtd inf USA)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Farmer in 1863. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from March 28, 1864, to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 434.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 434.
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890) Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War, Series M123, NARA RG 15, Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 14 of 14 of microfilm.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA,Film # 7016228: All Counties, 1920, File #8907, p. 2311 of 3309 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “Pvt Francis Rogers (1845-1920)," Memorial # 86373764, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86373764/francis-rogers (accessed January 26, 2021).
